newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn basis down, HRW wheat steady.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn basis down, HRW wheat steady.

text.p: FOB Gulf basis values for corn and soybeans slipped on Tuesday dragged down by slow export demand, dealers said. Winter wheat values were steady.

But interest from the Far East remains. State-owned Taiwan Sugar Corp will tender on Thursday for 20,000 tonnes of No.2 or better U.S. yellow corn and 10,000 tonnes of No.2 or better U.S. yellow soybeans, traders said.
A Taiwan Sugar buyer, who confirmed the tender plan, said the Iraq crisis already was driving international grain prices higher and that Thursday's tender was the soonest Taiwan Sugar could arrange.
Dealers quoted the following afternoon FOB U.S. Gulf values, basis Chicago futures, except hard red winter wheat basis Kansas City. (In cents per bushel).
No. 3 yellow corn -
FH September- 42 ov Sept bid, 45 offered
LH September- 32 ov Sept bid, 38 offered
Oct 15-30 - 40 ov Dec bid, 45 offered
Nov 1-15 - 36 ov Dec bid, 40 offered
No. 2 yellow soybeans
September 16-30- no bid, 54 ov Nov offered
October 1-20 - no bid, 44 ov Nov offered
October 12-31 - no bid, 35 ov Nov offered
November 1-20 - no bid, 33 ov Nov offered
November 11-30 - no bid, 33 ov Nov offered
December 1-20 - no bid, 33 ov Jan offered
December 12-31 - no bid, 36 ov Jan offered
HRW wheat
September - no bid, 44 ov Sep offered
October - no bid, 45 ov Dec offered
November - no bid, 47 ov Dec offered
SRW wheat
September - no bid, 24 ov Dec offered
October - no bid, 28 ov Dec offered
November - no bid, 33 ov Dec offered
--Chicago newsdesk 312-408 8720
